June Smallwood |warden1 = |website = [http://www.kingbaxgroup.org.uk/index.html Kingsbury And Baxterley Churches] |logo =}} '''The Church, Baxterley''' is a church near [[Wood End, Atherstone|Wood End]] in [[Warwickshire]], England, however it is named after the village of [[Baxterley]]. It is part of the parish of Baxterley with Hurley and Wood End. it dates from the 12th century. ==History== This small grade II [[Listed building|listed]] [[parish]] church is of square plan.{{cite web|title=Baxterley, North Warwickshire, Warwickshire|url=http://www.imagesofengland.org.uk/Details/Default.aspx?id=309173&mode=quick|work=Images of England|publisher=English Heritage|accessdate=29 August 2010}} The windows in the c. 12th–century [[chancel]] are small. The church has been extended in the 13th, 14th and 19th–centuries. The font is 15th–century.{{harvnb|Doubleday|1947}} The church dates from Norman Times and was built around 1200 AD with additions built throughout its life. The foundations of the nave Date from the 14th century. The base of the small tower was built around 1540 but the top section is early 17th century. The church was extensively rebuilt c. 1875 by Paull and Bickerdike. [[Hugh Latimer]], The [[Bishop of Oxford]] preached a sermon at Baxterley Church on Christmas Day 1552.[http://archivesunlocked.warwickshire.gov.uk/dserve.exe?dsqIni=Dserve.ini&dsqApp=Archive&dsqDb=Catalog&dsqCmd=Show.tcl&dsqSearch=%28RefNo==%2700142/15/3%27%29 Warwickshire's past unlocked] his niece, Mary Glover lived in [[Mancetter]], nearby.[http://www.hrionline.ac.uk/johnfoxe/apparatus/person_glossaryG.html John Foxe's book of martyrs] A 13th century wooden [[crozier]] head was found embedded in the wall in 1958; it is ''oldest piece of church equipment in Warwickshire''. [http://www.visitoruk.com/historydetail.php?id=50986&f=Birmingham VisitorUK.com] ==Profile== It is a small country church with a nave chancel and small tower, it is surrounded by a graveyard, it is built of stone The Church is situated around {{convert|1.7|mi|km|1}} from the village which when the church was built was the nearest settlement however since the construction of [[Wood End, Atherstone|Wood End]] in 1890 which is {{convert|1.2|mi|km|0}} away it has become the nearest settlement, The Church is surrounded by small farms. It is part of the Kingsbury and Baxterley group of churches along with [[Church of St Peter & St Paul, Kingsbury|Kingsbury]], [[St. Mary The Church of Our Lady Merevale|Merevale]], [[Church of the Resurrection, Hurley|Hurley]] and [[St Michael & All Angels Church, Wood End|Wood End]], All five share the same vicar who is currently Revd. Janet Gasper.{{cite web|title=KingsBaxtGroup.org|url=http://www.kingbaxgroup.org.uk/index.html|publisher=Kingsbury & Baxterley Group of Parish Churches|accessdate=29 August 2010}} It is part of the Deanery of Polesworth, which is part of the Arch Deanery of Aston. == References == ;Footnotes {{Reflist| group="nb" | colwidth=30em}} ;Notes {{Reflist|colwidth=30em}} ;Bibliography * {{Citation| editor-last = Doubleday| editor-first = Herbert Arthur | coauthors = William Page, Louis Francis Salzman | title = The Victoria History of the Counties of England: ''A history of the county of Warwick: Hemingford Hundred''| publisher = A Constanle| year = 1947| volume = IV| url = http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=42649 | pages = 151â159}} ==External links== *{{IoE|309173}} *[http://www.achurchnearyou.com/baxterley-the-mission-church/ A church Near you] *[http://www.baxterley.com/?page_id=19 Information From Baxterley.com] [[Category:Church of England churches in Warwickshire]] [[Category:Wood End, Atherstone]]
